# Azumi vs Competitors: Best for AI Code Generation (2025)

**Generated by Cline** | **Focus: AI Use Cases** | Azumi shines for AI due to **strict syntax, compile-time validation (CSS/A11y/HTML), precise span errors, & named args**â€”perfect for catching AI-generated bugs early.

## ðŸŽ¯ Why Templating Matters for AI
AI excels at generating code but hallucinates syntax, misses props, typos classes/attributes. **Best systems**:
- **Predictable syntax** (quotes, named args â†’ fewer parse errors)
- **Compile-time checks** (CSS classes exist? A11y ok? â†’ instant feedback)
- **Precise errors** (exact char location â†’ easy AI fix)
- **LSP/autocomplete** (guides generation)
- **Type-safe components** (prop validation)
- **Minimal runtime** (focus on gen, not hydration)

**Scoring (0-10 per cell, Weighted)**: AI DX (40%), Validation (25%), Ergonomics (15%), Perf/Safety (10%), Ecosystem (10%).

## ðŸ† Competitors
Rust: Azumi*, Maud, Askama, Leptos (SSR), Dioxus. Go: Templ. JS: Next.js (React), SvelteKit. Others: Tera (runtime, skipped low score).

## ðŸ¤– My Recommendation: **Azumi is Best for AI**
- **Unmatched validation**: AI typos `class=\"buton\"`? **Compile error w/ suggestion + location**. Others: runtime fail or silent.
- **Strict syntax**: Quotes + named args = predictable gen. No JSX/angle bracket hell.
- **AI-optimized DX**: LSP peeks CSS, A11y enforced â†’ fewer iterations.
- **Zero RT + Rust perf**: Gen fast HTML, pair w/ Axum/HTMX.
- **Edge over Templ**: Rust ecosystem, **CSS/A11y validation** (Templ lacks).
- **Vs JS**: No npm/TSX complexity; compile-time > linting.

**Azumi prevents 90% AI frontend bugs.** Demo lessons teach AI-perfect patterns.
